component.title: MyBatis
component.description: Performs a query poll insert update or delete in a relational database using MyBatis.
component.label: database,sql

configurationUri.description: Location of MyBatis xml configuration file. The default value is: SqlMapConfig.xml loaded from the classpath

statement.description: The statement name in the MyBatis XML mapping file which maps to the query insert update or delete operation you wish to evaluate.

outputHeader.description: Store the query result in a header instead of the message body. By default outputHeader == null and the query result is stored in the message body any existing content in the message body is discarded. If outputHeader is set the value is used as the name of the header to store the query result and the original message body is preserved. Setting outputHeader will also omit populating the default CamelMyBatisResult header since it would be the same as outputHeader all the time.

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

inputHeader.label: consumer
inputHeader.description: User the header value for input parameters instead of the message body. By default inputHeader == null and the input parameters are taken from the message body. If outputHeader is set the value is used and query parameters will be taken from the header instead of the body.

maxMessagesPerPoll.label: consumer
maxMessagesPerPoll.description: This option is intended to split results returned by the database pool into the batches and deliver them in multiple exchanges. This integer defines the maximum messages to deliver in single exchange. By default no maximum is set. Can be used to set a limit of e.g. 1000 to avoid when starting up the server that there are thousands of files. Set a value of 0 or negative to disable it.

onConsume.label: consumer
onConsume.description: Statement to run after data has been processed in the route

routeEmptyResultSet.label: consumer
routeEmptyResultSet.description: Whether allow empty resultset to be routed to the next hop

sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.label: consumer
sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

transacted.label: consumer
transacted.description: Enables or disables transaction. If enabled then if processing an exchange failed then the consumer break out processing any further exchanges to cause a rollback eager

useIterator.label: consumer
useIterator.description: Process resultset individually or as a list

exceptionHandler.label: consumer,advanced
exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

pollStrategy.label: consumer,advanced
pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

executorType.label: producer
executorType.description: The executor type to be used while executing statements. simple - executor does nothing special. reuse - executor reuses prepared statements. batch - executor reuses statements and batches updates.

statementType.label: producer
statementType.description: Mandatory to specify for the producer to control which kind of operation to invoke.

synchronous.label: advanced
synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

backoffErrorThreshold.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffErrorThreshold.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

backoffIdleThreshold.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffIdleThreshold.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

backoffMultiplier.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

delay.label: consumer,scheduler
delay.description: Milliseconds before the next poll. You can also specify time values using units such as 60s (60 seconds) 5m30s (5 minutes and 30 seconds) and 1h (1 hour).

greedy.label: consumer,scheduler
greedy.description: If greedy is enabled then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

initialDelay.label: consumer,scheduler
initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts. You can also specify time values using units such as 60s (60 seconds) 5m30s (5 minutes and 30 seconds) and 1h (1 hour).

runLoggingLevel.label: consumer,scheduler
runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

scheduledExecutorService.label: consumer,scheduler
scheduledExecutorService.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

scheduler.label: consumer,scheduler
scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz2 component

schedulerProperties.label: consumer,scheduler
schedulerProperties.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz2 Spring based scheduler.

startScheduler.label: consumer,scheduler
startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

timeUnit.label: consumer,scheduler
timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

useFixedDelay.label: consumer,scheduler
useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.
